citation.article-title: The Nocardia salmonicida clade, including descriptions of Nocardia cummidelens sp. nov., Nocardia fluminea sp. nov. and Nocardia soli sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Nocardia fluminea sp. nov.
Nocardia fluminea (flu.men. L. n. flumen, river; L. adj. fluminea, from the river)
Brownish colonies carrying sparse aerial hyphae and forming a brown diffusible pigment on GYEA.
Colony elevation is convex to irregular and colony margins filamentous.
Allantoin and arbutin; but not hippurate, are hydrolysed.
Degrades Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 but not cellulose, chitin or xylan.
Grows on glucose (1%, w/v), inositol (1%, w/v) and sodium butyrate (0.1%, w/v) as sole carbon sources for energy and growth but not on meso-inositol (1%, w/v) or sodium acetate (0.1%, w/v).
Grows well at 10 and 30°C and between pH 5 and 8.

Resistant to lysozyme but sensitive to cephaloridine hydrochloride (16 µg ml-11), demethylchlortetracycline hydrochloride (16), gentamicin sulphate (8), neomycin sulphate (8), rifampicin (1), streptomycin sulphate (16) and tobramycin sulphate (1).
Additional phenotypic properties are shown in Table 2.
Isolated from soil adjacent to the River Thames, Medmenham, UK.
